metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14386 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel before 5.9-rc4. Memory corruption can be exploited to gain root privileges from unprivileged processes. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity. Or Cohen discovered that the AF_PACKET implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform bounds checking in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14386` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19

notes.Note: sbeattie> requires CAP_NET_RAW cascardo> Added break as investigated by Solar Designer. sbeattie> older backports without 8e8e2951e309 will need second lore.kernel.org variant

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1082.86~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1095.105~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1083.94~16.04.1').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-117.118~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1053.57~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
